alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 07 at 10:49AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northeast Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Ashland and Richland. In northeast Ohio, Holmes and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1047 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mansfield, Wooster, Ashland, Millersburg, Orrville, Berlin, Ontario, Lexington, Crestline, Walnut Creek, Loudonville, Bellville, Dalton, Shreve, Killbuck, Hayesville, Holmesville, Glenmont, Mount Eaton and Nashville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
